intro: Alfredia tianschanica, commonly known as the Tianshan alfredia, is a flowering plant native to the Tianshan mountain range in Central Asia. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps reduce water loss. Alfredia tianschanica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
